content.question: Which of the following best explains why the invention of the birth control pill after the Second World War was seen as a positive development by many European feminists?

choices.label: It afforded women the opportunity to make more choices regarding careers, family, and education.
It allowed women to challenge the predominant ideologies of consumer capitalism and communism.
It gave women the opportunity to lessen their impact on the natural environment by limiting the size of their families.
It reinforced the importance of the traditional nuclear family in European life.

content.answer: It afforded women the opportunity to make more choices regarding careers, family, and education.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
